intro: Goughia himalensis, commonly known as the Himalayan goughia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink. Goughia himalensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and forest edges.
